subsubsection.p:
Look up the definitions of new terms in the Glossary.
Logarithm
Common logarithm

li.p: We use logarithms to help us solve exponential equations.
The base b logarithm of x, written \log_b x, is the exponent to which b must be raised in order to yield x.
If b\gt 0 and x \gt 0, y=\log_b x ~~~ \text{ if and only if } ~~~x=b^y
The operation of taking a base b logarithm is the inverse operation for raising the base b to a power.
Base 10 logarithms are called common logarithms, and \log x means \log_{10} x.
